speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: SCENE IV. Before the palace.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Enter QUEEN MARGARET

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: So, now prosperity begins to mellow

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And drop into the rotten mouth of death.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Here in these confines slily have I lurk'd,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: To watch the waning of mine adversaries.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: A dire induction am I witness to,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And will to France, hoping the consequence

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Will prove as bitter, black, and tragical.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Withdraw thee, wretched Margaret: who comes here?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Enter QUEEN ELIZABETH and the DUCHESS OF YORK

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Ah, my young princes! ah, my tender babes!

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: My unblown flowers, new-appearing sweets!

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: If yet your gentle souls fly in the air

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: And be not fix'd in doom perpetual,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Hover about me with your airy wings

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: And hear your mother's lamentation!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Hover about her; say, that right for right

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Hath dimm'd your infant morn to aged night.

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: So many miseries have crazed my voice,

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: That my woe-wearied tongue is mute and dumb,

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Edward Plantagenet, why art thou dead?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Plantagenet doth quit Plantagenet.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Edward for Edward pays a dying debt.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Wilt thou, O God, fly from such gentle lambs,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: And throw them in the entrails of the wolf?

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: When didst thou sleep when such a deed was done?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: When holy Harry died, and my sweet son.

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Blind sight, dead life, poor mortal living ghost,

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Woe's scene, world's shame, grave's due by life usurp'd,

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Brief abstract and record of tedious days,

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Rest thy unrest on England's lawful earth,

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Sitting down

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Unlawfully made drunk with innocents' blood!

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: O, that thou wouldst as well afford a grave

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: As thou canst yield a melancholy seat!

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Then would I hide my bones, not rest them here.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: O, who hath any cause to mourn but I?

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Sitting down by her

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: If ancient sorrow be most reverend,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Give mine the benefit of seniory,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And let my woes frown on the upper hand.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: If sorrow can admit society,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Sitting down with them

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Tell o'er your woes again by viewing mine:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I had an Edward, till a Richard kill'd him;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I had a Harry, till a Richard kill'd him:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Thou hadst an Edward, till a Richard kill'd him;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Thou hadst a Richard, till a Richard killed him;

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: I had a Richard too, and thou didst kill him;

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: I had a Rutland too, thou holp'st to kill him.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Thou hadst a Clarence too, and Richard kill'd him.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: From forth the kennel of thy womb hath crept

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: A hell-hound that doth hunt us all to death:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: That dog, that had his teeth before his eyes,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: To worry lambs and lap their gentle blood,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: That foul defacer of God's handiwork,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: That excellent grand tyrant of the earth,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: That reigns in galled eyes of weeping souls,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Thy womb let loose, to chase us to our graves.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: O upright, just, and true-disposing God,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: How do I thank thee, that this carnal cur

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Preys on the issue of his mother's body,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And makes her pew-fellow with others' moan!

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: O Harry's wife, triumph not in my woes!

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: God witness with me, I have wept for thine.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Bear with me; I am hungry for revenge,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And now I cloy me with beholding it.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Thy Edward he is dead, that stabb'd my Edward:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Thy other Edward dead, to quit my Edward;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Young York he is but boot, because both they

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Match not the high perfection of my loss:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Thy Clarence he is dead that kill'd my Edward;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And the beholders of this tragic play,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: The adulterate Hastings, Rivers, Vaughan, Grey,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Untimely smother'd in their dusky graves.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Richard yet lives, hell's black intelligencer,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Only reserved their factor, to buy souls

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And send them thither: but at hand, at hand,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Ensues his piteous and unpitied end:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Earth gapes, hell burns, fiends roar, saints pray.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: To have him suddenly convey'd away.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Cancel his bond of life, dear God, I prey,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: That I may live to say, The dog is dead!

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: O, thou didst prophesy the time would come

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: That I should wish for thee to help me curse

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: That bottled spider, that foul bunch-back'd toad!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I call'd thee then vain flourish of my fortune;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I call'd thee then poor shadow, painted queen;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: The presentation of but what I was;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: The flattering index of a direful pageant;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: One heaved a-high, to be hurl'd down below;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: A mother only mock'd with two sweet babes;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: A dream of what thou wert, a breath, a bubble,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: A sign of dignity, a garish flag,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: To be the aim of every dangerous shot,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: A queen in jest, only to fill the scene.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Where is thy husband now? where be thy brothers?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Where are thy children? wherein dost thou, joy?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Who sues to thee and cries 'God save the queen'?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Where be the bending peers that flatter'd thee?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Where be the thronging troops that follow'd thee?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Decline all this, and see what now thou art:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: For happy wife, a most distressed widow;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: For joyful mother, one that wails the name;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: For queen, a very caitiff crown'd with care;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: For one being sued to, one that humbly sues;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: For one that scorn'd at me, now scorn'd of me;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: For one being fear'd of all, now fearing one;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: For one commanding all, obey'd of none.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Thus hath the course of justice wheel'd about,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And left thee but a very prey to time;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Having no more but thought of what thou wert,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: To torture thee the more, being what thou art.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Thou didst usurp my place, and dost thou not

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Usurp the just proportion of my sorrow?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Now thy proud neck bears half my burthen'd yoke;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: From which even here I slip my weary neck,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And leave the burthen of it all on thee.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Farewell, York's wife, and queen of sad mischance:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: These English woes will make me smile in France.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: O thou well skill'd in curses, stay awhile,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: And teach me how to curse mine enemies!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Forbear to sleep the nights, and fast the days;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Compare dead happiness with living woe;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Think that thy babes were fairer than they were,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And he that slew them fouler than he is:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Bettering thy loss makes the bad causer worse:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Revolving this will teach thee how to curse.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: My words are dull; O, quicken them with thine!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Thy woes will make them sharp, and pierce like mine.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Exit

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Why should calamity be full of words?

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Windy attorneys to their client woes,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Airy succeeders of intestate joys,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Poor breathing orators of miseries!

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Let them have scope: though what they do impart

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Help not all, yet do they ease the heart.

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: If so, then be not tongue-tied: go with me.

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: And in the breath of bitter words let's smother

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: My damned son, which thy two sweet sons smother'd.

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: I hear his drum: be copious in exclaims.

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Enter KING RICHARD III, marching, with drums and trumpets

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Who intercepts my expedition?

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: O, she that might have intercepted thee,

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: By strangling thee in her accursed womb

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: From all the slaughters, wretch, that thou hast done!

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Hidest thou that forehead with a golden crown,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Where should be graven, if that right were right,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: The slaughter of the prince that owed that crown,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: And the dire death of my two sons and brothers?

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Tell me, thou villain slave, where are my children?

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Thou toad, thou toad, where is thy brother Clarence?

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: And little Ned Plantagenet, his son?

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Where is kind Hastings, Rivers, Vaughan, Grey?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: A flourish, trumpets! strike alarum, drums!

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Let not the heavens hear these tell-tale women

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Rail on the Lord's enointed: strike, I say!

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Flourish. Alarums

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Either be patient, and entreat me fair,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Or with the clamorous report of war

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Thus will I drown your exclamations.

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Art thou my son?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Ay, I thank God, my father, and yourself.

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Then patiently hear my impatience.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Madam, I have a touch of your condition,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Which cannot brook the accent of reproof.

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: O, let me speak!

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Do then: but I'll not hear.

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: I will be mild and gentle in my speech.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: And brief, good mother; for I am in haste.

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Art thou so hasty? I have stay'd for thee,

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: God knows, in anguish, pain and agony.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: And came I not at last to comfort you?

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: No, by the holy rood, thou know'st it well,

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Thou camest on earth to make the earth my hell.

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: A grievous burthen was thy birth to me;

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Tetchy and wayward was thy infancy;

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Thy school-days frightful, desperate, wild, and furious,

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Thy prime of manhood daring, bold, and venturous,

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Thy age confirm'd, proud, subdued, bloody,

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: treacherous,

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: More mild, but yet more harmful, kind in hatred:

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: What comfortable hour canst thou name,

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: That ever graced me in thy company?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Faith, none, but Humphrey Hour, that call'd

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: your grace

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: To breakfast once forth of my company.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: If I be so disgracious in your sight,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Let me march on, and not offend your grace.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Strike the drum.

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: I prithee, hear me speak.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: You speak too bitterly.

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Hear me a word;

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: For I shall never speak to thee again.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: So.

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Either thou wilt die, by God's just ordinance,

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Ere from this war thou turn a conqueror,

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Or I with grief and extreme age shall perish

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: And never look upon thy face again.

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Therefore take with thee my most heavy curse;

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Which, in the day of battle, tire thee more

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Than all the complete armour that thou wear'st!

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: My prayers on the adverse party fight;

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: And there the little souls of Edward's children

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Whisper the spirits of thine enemies

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: And promise them success and victory.

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Bloody thou art, bloody will be thy end;

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Shame serves thy life and doth thy death attend.

speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
text_entry: Exit

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Though far more cause, yet much less spirit to curse

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Abides in me; I say amen to all.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Stay, madam; I must speak a word with you.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: I have no more sons of the royal blood

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: For thee to murder: for my daughters, Richard,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: They shall be praying nuns, not weeping queens;

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: And therefore level not to hit their lives.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: You have a daughter call'd Elizabeth,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Virtuous and fair, royal and gracious.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: And must she die for this? O, let her live,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: And I'll corrupt her manners, stain her beauty;

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Slander myself as false to Edward's bed;

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Throw over her the veil of infamy:

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: So she may live unscarr'd of bleeding slaughter,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: I will confess she was not Edward's daughter.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Wrong not her birth, she is of royal blood.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: To save her life, I'll say she is not so.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Her life is only safest in her birth.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: And only in that safety died her brothers.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Lo, at their births good stars were opposite.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: No, to their lives bad friends were contrary.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: All unavoided is the doom of destiny.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: True, when avoided grace makes destiny:

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: My babes were destined to a fairer death,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: If grace had bless'd thee with a fairer life.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: You speak as if that I had slain my cousins.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Cousins, indeed; and by their uncle cozen'd

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Of comfort, kingdom, kindred, freedom, life.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Whose hand soever lanced their tender hearts,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Thy head, all indirectly, gave direction:

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: No doubt the murderous knife was dull and blunt

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Till it was whetted on thy stone-hard heart,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: To revel in the entrails of my lambs.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: But that still use of grief makes wild grief tame,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: My tongue should to thy ears not name my boys

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Till that my nails were anchor'd in thine eyes;

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: And I, in such a desperate bay of death,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Like a poor bark, of sails and tackling reft,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Rush all to pieces on thy rocky bosom.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Madam, so thrive I in my enterprise

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: And dangerous success of bloody wars,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: As I intend more good to you and yours,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Than ever you or yours were by me wrong'd!

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: What good is cover'd with the face of heaven,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: To be discover'd, that can do me good?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: The advancement of your children, gentle lady.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Up to some scaffold, there to lose their heads?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: No, to the dignity and height of honour

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: The high imperial type of this earth's glory.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Flatter my sorrows with report of it;

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Tell me what state, what dignity, what honour,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Canst thou demise to any child of mine?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Even all I have; yea, and myself and all,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Will I withal endow a child of thine;

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: So in the Lethe of thy angry soul

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Thou drown the sad remembrance of those wrongs

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Which thou supposest I have done to thee.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Be brief, lest that be process of thy kindness

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Last longer telling than thy kindness' date.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Then know, that from my soul I love thy daughter.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: My daughter's mother thinks it with her soul.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: What do you think?

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: That thou dost love my daughter from thy soul:

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: So from thy soul's love didst thou love her brothers;

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: And from my heart's love I do thank thee for it.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Be not so hasty to confound my meaning:

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: I mean, that with my soul I love thy daughter,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: And mean to make her queen of England.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Say then, who dost thou mean shall be her king?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Even he that makes her queen who should be else?

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: What, thou?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: I, even I: what think you of it, madam?

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: How canst thou woo her?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: That would I learn of you,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: As one that are best acquainted with her humour.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: And wilt thou learn of me?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Madam, with all my heart.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Send to her, by the man that slew her brothers,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: A pair of bleeding-hearts; thereon engrave

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Edward and York; then haply she will weep:

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Therefore present to her--as sometime Margaret

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Did to thy father, steep'd in Rutland's blood,--

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: A handkerchief; which, say to her, did drain

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: The purple sap from her sweet brother's body

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: And bid her dry her weeping eyes therewith.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: If this inducement force her not to love,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Send her a story of thy noble acts;

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Tell her thou madest away her uncle Clarence,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Her uncle Rivers; yea, and, for her sake,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Madest quick conveyance with her good aunt Anne.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Come, come, you mock me; this is not the way

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: To win our daughter.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: There is no other way

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Unless thou couldst put on some other shape,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: And not be Richard that hath done all this.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Say that I did all this for love of her.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Nay, then indeed she cannot choose but hate thee,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Having bought love with such a bloody spoil.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Look, what is done cannot be now amended:

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Men shall deal unadvisedly sometimes,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Which after hours give leisure to repent.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: If I did take the kingdom from your sons,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: To make amends, Ill give it to your daughter.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: If I have kill'd the issue of your womb,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: To quicken your increase, I will beget

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Mine issue of your blood upon your daughter

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: A grandam's name is little less in love

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Than is the doting title of a mother;

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: They are as children but one step below,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Even of your mettle, of your very blood;

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Of an one pain, save for a night of groans

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Endured of her, for whom you bid like sorrow.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Your children were vexation to your youth,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: But mine shall be a comfort to your age.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: The loss you have is but a son being king,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: And by that loss your daughter is made queen.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: I cannot make you what amends I would,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Therefore accept such kindness as I can.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Dorset your son, that with a fearful soul

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Leads discontented steps in foreign soil,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: This fair alliance quickly shall call home

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: To high promotions and great dignity:

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: The king, that calls your beauteous daughter wife.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Familiarly shall call thy Dorset brother;

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Again shall you be mother to a king,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: And all the ruins of distressful times

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Repair'd with double riches of content.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: What! we have many goodly days to see:

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: The liquid drops of tears that you have shed

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Shall come again, transform'd to orient pearl,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Advantaging their loan with interest

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Of ten times double gain of happiness.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Go, then my mother, to thy daughter go

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Make bold her bashful years with your experience;

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Prepare her ears to hear a wooer's tale

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Put in her tender heart the aspiring flame

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Of golden sovereignty; acquaint the princess

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: With the sweet silent hours of marriage joys

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: And when this arm of mine hath chastised

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: The petty rebel, dull-brain'd Buckingham,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Bound with triumphant garlands will I come

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: And lead thy daughter to a conqueror's bed;

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: To whom I will retail my conquest won,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: And she shall be sole victress, Caesar's Caesar.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: What were I best to say? her father's brother

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Would be her lord? or shall I say, her uncle?

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Or, he that slew her brothers and her uncles?

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Under what title shall I woo for thee,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: That God, the law, my honour and her love,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Can make seem pleasing to her tender years?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Infer fair England's peace by this alliance.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Which she shall purchase with still lasting war.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Say that the king, which may command, entreats.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: That at her hands which the king's King forbids.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Say, she shall be a high and mighty queen.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: To wail the tide, as her mother doth.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Say, I will love her everlastingly.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: But how long shall that title 'ever' last?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Sweetly in force unto her fair life's end.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: But how long fairly shall her sweet lie last?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: So long as heaven and nature lengthens it.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: So long as hell and Richard likes of it.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Say, I, her sovereign, am her subject love.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: But she, your subject, loathes such sovereignty.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Be eloquent in my behalf to her.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: An honest tale speeds best being plainly told.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Then in plain terms tell her my loving tale.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Plain and not honest is too harsh a style.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Your reasons are too shallow and too quick.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: O no, my reasons are too deep and dead;

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Too deep and dead, poor infants, in their grave.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Harp not on that string, madam; that is past.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Harp on it still shall I till heart-strings break.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Now, by my George, my garter, and my crown,--

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Profaned, dishonour'd, and the third usurp'd.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: I swear--

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: By nothing; for this is no oath:

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: The George, profaned, hath lost his holy honour;

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: The garter, blemish'd, pawn'd his knightly virtue;

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: The crown, usurp'd, disgraced his kingly glory.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: if something thou wilt swear to be believed,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Swear then by something that thou hast not wrong'd.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Now, by the world--

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: 'Tis full of thy foul wrongs.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: My father's death--

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Thy life hath that dishonour'd.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Then, by myself--

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Thyself thyself misusest.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Why then, by God--

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: God's wrong is most of all.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: If thou hadst fear'd to break an oath by Him,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: The unity the king thy brother made

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Had not been broken, nor my brother slain:

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: If thou hadst fear'd to break an oath by Him,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: The imperial metal, circling now thy brow,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Had graced the tender temples of my child,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: And both the princes had been breathing here,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Which now, two tender playfellows to dust,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Thy broken faith hath made a prey for worms.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: What canst thou swear by now?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: The time to come.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: That thou hast wronged in the time o'erpast;

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: For I myself have many tears to wash

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Hereafter time, for time past wrong'd by thee.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: The children live, whose parents thou hast

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: slaughter'd,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Ungovern'd youth, to wail it in their age;

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: The parents live, whose children thou hast butcher'd,

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Old wither'd plants, to wail it with their age.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Swear not by time to come; for that thou hast

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Misused ere used, by time misused o'erpast.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: As I intend to prosper and repent,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: So thrive I in my dangerous attempt

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Of hostile arms! myself myself confound!

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Heaven and fortune bar me happy hours!

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Day, yield me not thy light; nor, night, thy rest!

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Be opposite all planets of good luck

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: To my proceedings, if, with pure heart's love,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Immaculate devotion, holy thoughts,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: I tender not thy beauteous princely daughter!

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: In her consists my happiness and thine;

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Without her, follows to this land and me,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: To thee, herself, and many a Christian soul,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Death, desolation, ruin and decay:

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: It cannot be avoided but by this;

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: It will not be avoided but by this.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Therefore, good mother,--I must can you so--

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Be the attorney of my love to her:

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Plead what I will be, not what I have been;

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Not my deserts, but what I will deserve:

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Urge the necessity and state of times,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: And be not peevish-fond in great designs.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Shall I be tempted of the devil thus?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Ay, if the devil tempt thee to do good.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Shall I forget myself to be myself?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Ay, if yourself's remembrance wrong yourself.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: But thou didst kill my children.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: But in your daughter's womb I bury them:

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Where in that nest of spicery they shall breed

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Selves of themselves, to your recomforture.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: Shall I go win my daughter to thy will?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: And be a happy mother by the deed.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: I go. Write to me very shortly.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
text_entry: And you shall understand from me her mind.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Bear her my true love's kiss; and so, farewell.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Exit QUEEN ELIZABETH

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Relenting fool, and shallow, changing woman!

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Enter RATCLIFF; CATESBY following

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: How now! what news?

speaker: RATCLIFF
text_entry: My gracious sovereign, on the western coast

speaker: RATCLIFF
text_entry: Rideth a puissant navy; to the shore

speaker: RATCLIFF
text_entry: Throng many doubtful hollow-hearted friends,

speaker: RATCLIFF
text_entry: Unarm'd, and unresolved to beat them back:

speaker: RATCLIFF
text_entry: 'Tis thought that Richmond is their admiral;

speaker: RATCLIFF
text_entry: And there they hull, expecting but the aid

speaker: RATCLIFF
text_entry: Of Buckingham to welcome them ashore.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Some light-foot friend post to the Duke of Norfolk:

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Ratcliff, thyself, or Catesby; where is he?

speaker: CATESBY
text_entry: Here, my lord.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Fly to the duke:

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: To RATCLIFF

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Post thou to Salisbury

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: When thou comest thither--

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: To CATESBY

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Dull, unmindful villain,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Why stand'st thou still, and go'st not to the duke?

speaker: CATESBY
text_entry: First, mighty sovereign, let me know your mind,

speaker: CATESBY
text_entry: What from your grace I shall deliver to him.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: O, true, good Catesby: bid him levy straight

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: The greatest strength and power he can make,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: And meet me presently at Salisbury.

speaker: CATESBY
text_entry: I go.

speaker: CATESBY
text_entry: Exit

speaker: RATCLIFF
text_entry: What is't your highness' pleasure I shall do at

speaker: RATCLIFF
text_entry: Salisbury?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Why, what wouldst thou do there before I go?

speaker: RATCLIFF
text_entry: Your highness told me I should post before.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: My mind is changed, sir, my mind is changed.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Enter STANLEY

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: How now, what news with you?

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: None good, my lord, to please you with the hearing;

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: Nor none so bad, but it may well be told.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Hoyday, a riddle! neither good nor bad!

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Why dost thou run so many mile about,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: When thou mayst tell thy tale a nearer way?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Once more, what news?

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: Richmond is on the seas.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: There let him sink, and be the seas on him!

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: White-liver'd runagate, what doth he there?

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: I know not, mighty sovereign, but by guess.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Well, sir, as you guess, as you guess?

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: Stirr'd up by Dorset, Buckingham, and Ely,

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: He makes for England, there to claim the crown.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Is the chair empty? is the sword unsway'd?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Is the king dead? the empire unpossess'd?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: What heir of York is there alive but we?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: And who is England's king but great York's heir?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Then, tell me, what doth he upon the sea?

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: Unless for that, my liege, I cannot guess.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Unless for that he comes to be your liege,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: You cannot guess wherefore the Welshman comes.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Thou wilt revolt, and fly to him, I fear.

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: No, mighty liege; therefore mistrust me not.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Where is thy power, then, to beat him back?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Where are thy tenants and thy followers?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Are they not now upon the western shore.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Safe-conducting the rebels from their ships!

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: No, my good lord, my friends are in the north.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Cold friends to Richard: what do they in the north,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: When they should serve their sovereign in the west?

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: They have not been commanded, mighty sovereign:

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: Please it your majesty to give me leave,

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: I'll muster up my friends, and meet your grace

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: Where and what time your majesty shall please.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Ay, ay. thou wouldst be gone to join with Richmond:

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: I will not trust you, sir.

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: Most mighty sovereign,

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: You have no cause to hold my friendship doubtful:

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: I never was nor never will be false.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Well,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Go muster men; but, hear you, leave behind

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Your son, George Stanley: look your faith be firm.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Or else his head's assurance is but frail.

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: So deal with him as I prove true to you.

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: Exit

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: Enter a Messenger

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: My gracious sovereign, now in Devonshire,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: As I by friends am well advertised,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Sir Edward Courtney, and the haughty prelate

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Bishop of Exeter, his brother there,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: With many more confederates, are in arms.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Enter another Messenger

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: My liege, in Kent the Guildfords are in arms;

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: And every hour more competitors

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: Flock to their aid, and still their power increaseth.

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: Enter another Messenger

speaker: Third Messenger
text_entry: My lord, the army of the Duke of Buckingham--

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Out on you, owls! nothing but songs of death?

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: He striketh him

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Take that, until thou bring me better news.

speaker: Third Messenger
text_entry: The news I have to tell your majesty

speaker: Third Messenger
text_entry: Is, that by sudden floods and fall of waters,

speaker: Third Messenger
text_entry: Buckingham's army is dispersed and scatter'd;

speaker: Third Messenger
text_entry: And he himself wander'd away alone,

speaker: Third Messenger
text_entry: No man knows whither.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: I cry thee mercy:

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: There is my purse to cure that blow of thine.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Hath any well-advised friend proclaim'd

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Reward to him that brings the traitor in?

speaker: Third Messenger
text_entry: Such proclamation hath been made, my liege.

speaker: Third Messenger
text_entry: Enter another Messenger

speaker: Fourth Messenger
text_entry: Sir Thomas Lovel and Lord Marquis Dorset,

speaker: Fourth Messenger
text_entry: 'Tis said, my liege, in Yorkshire are in arms.

speaker: Fourth Messenger
text_entry: Yet this good comfort bring I to your grace,

speaker: Fourth Messenger
text_entry: The Breton navy is dispersed by tempest:

speaker: Fourth Messenger
text_entry: Richmond, in Yorkshire, sent out a boat

speaker: Fourth Messenger
text_entry: Unto the shore, to ask those on the banks

speaker: Fourth Messenger
text_entry: If they were his assistants, yea or no;

speaker: Fourth Messenger
text_entry: Who answer'd him, they came from Buckingham.

speaker: Fourth Messenger
text_entry: Upon his party: he, mistrusting them,

speaker: Fourth Messenger
text_entry: Hoisted sail and made away for Brittany.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: March on, march on, since we are up in arms;

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: If not to fight with foreign enemies,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Yet to beat down these rebels here at home.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Re-enter CATESBY

speaker: CATESBY
text_entry: My liege, the Duke of Buckingham is taken;

speaker: CATESBY
text_entry: That is the best news: that the Earl of Richmond

speaker: CATESBY
text_entry: Is with a mighty power landed at Milford,

speaker: CATESBY
text_entry: Is colder tidings, yet they must be told.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Away towards Salisbury! while we reason here,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: A royal battle might be won and lost

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Some one take order Buckingham be brought

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: To Salisbury; the rest march on with me.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Flourish. Exeunt
